data.title: 1234: Thursday 10 June 2010 Dear Members of the Loyola College ...
data.meta_description: 1234: Thursday 10 June 2010 Dear Members of the Loyola College ...
data.text: Dear Members of the Loyola College Community, 1234: Thursday 10 June 2010 In the last fortnight we have been saddened by a student accident that occurred at the College which resulted in extensive injuries to one of our Year 11 students, Stephen Callinan (11MMCB). When such events occur the community rallies to provide support and I am very grateful to everyone who has sent cards and emails expressing their support and indicating that they are praying with us for Stephen. Each day the St Ignatius Chapel has been filled with staff, students and members of the community as we have gathered for the Novena prayer for Stephen. The Callinan family are very grateful for all the prayers and support as we all continue to pray that Stephen will be able to make a full recovery. Working Bee I wish to thank the parents and students who attended the recent working bee. The gardens around the newly renovated science laboratories were upgraded and are looking wonderful. My thanks to Mr Kelly (College Gardener) and Sam Bonello one of our Loyola students who is engaged by the College under the Australian School Based Apprenticeship in Horticulture, for overseeing the development of the area together with Mr Tony Romano from the LPFA. Canonisation of Mary MacKillop I am delighted to announce that Victoria Eley (11KGKK) will represent Loyola College at the canonisation ceremony of Mary MacKillop in mid October this year. Eight Year 11 students were interviewed as part of the process and I thank them for their interest. Congratulations to Victoria. I am sure we all look forward to hearing of her experiences on her return. Capital Development There are currently two projects underway in this area. Redevelopment of the Old Loyola Courtyard commenced last week. This project includes the redesign and concreting of walking paths in the courtyard area. The next phase will see the redevelopment of the current paved area and finally the upgrading of the gardens. It is hoped that this project will be completed by the end of this year.
